thread.title: High school football roundup
thread.title_full: High school football roundup - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: High school football roundup
text:
CLASS A
South Glens Falls 21, Gloversville 14
Player of the game: Zach Ahrens had a touchdown, a two-point conversion run and an extra point to help South Glens Falls win.
Play of the game: Evan Benosky's three-yard touchdown run clinched the victory for the Bulldogs.
Notable: Taylor McCredie threw for a score and ran for a score to lead Gloversville. ... Ahrens broke off a 50-yard touchdown run for his lone score.
Amsterdam 35, Bishop Maginn 0
Player of the game: Brian Stanavich came into the game with 15 touchdowns and added two. He ran for 170 yards.
Notable: Amsterdam improves to 4-3, and Bishop Maginn drops to 0-7.
CLASS B
Hudson 48, Albany Academy 11
Player of the game: Mike Alert scored two rushing touchdowns and had a receiving touchdown to lead Hudson.
Play of the game: Marcus Reid returned a punt 62 yards for a score to give Hudson a 12-3 advantage.
Stat of the game: Hudson totaled 324 yards rushing.
Notable: Willie Walker finished with 104 yards on the ground to lead Hudson. ... Merlin Thomas had 79 yards and a score on the ground for Albany Academy.
Glens Falls 49, Hudson Falls 7
Player of the game: Andrew Murphy had a kick return for a score and caught four touchdown passes, all in the second quarter, to lead Glens Falls.
Play of the game: Murphy took the game's opening kickoff and returned it 89 yards for a score for Glens Falls.
Stat of the game: Murphy finished with six catches for 165 yards.
Notable: Glens Falls scored 35 points in the second quarter to blow open the game. ... Aaron Sampson finished with 75 yards and two scores on the ground for Glens Falls. ... Glens Falls outgained Hudson Falls, 402-136, in total offense.
CLASS C
Voorheesville 34, Schoburg/BKW 0
Player of the game: Dalton Esposito had two rushing touchdowns to lead Voorheesville.
Play of the game: Michael McGuinness hauled in a 12-yard touchdown pass in the third quarter to put the game away for the Blackbirds.
Fonda 35, Coxsackie-Athens 13
Player of the game: Fonda's Dan Parslow went 12-for-16 passing for 203 yards and three touchdowns.
Notable: It was a close game up until the half, but Fonda came out and blew open the game by scoring three straight touchdowns. The game wrapped up the Class C South Division title, which Fonda won outright.
Hoosic Valley 49, Granville 0
Player of the game: Hoosic Valley's Tom Madigan rushed seven times for 214 yards and four touchdowns.
Play of the game: On the opening play from scrimmage, Madigan ran for 75 yards and a touchdown.
Stat of the game: Hoosic Valley's defense held Granville to 25 rushes for a total of -15 yards.
Notable: Hoosic Valley has made it to the playoffs for the first time in school history.
CLASS D
Warrensburg 49, Salem 20
Player of the game: Donnie Stone rushed for 103 yards and two touchdowns for Warrensburg.
Play of the game: Jake Nemec broke an 83-yard touchdown run in the first quarter to put Warrensburg up 22-8.
Stat of the game: The Burgers had three 100-yard rushers: Stone, Joey Schuster (113) and Nemec (102).
Notable: Warrensburg scored 35 points in the opening quarter. ... Right after Nemec broke the 83-yard touchdown run, he returned a fumble 58 yards for another score. ... Miguel Taylor had 105 yards on the ground for Salem.
NONLEAGUE
Cobleskill 27, Holy Trinity 21
Notable: Cobleskill (1-6) earned its first win of the season. ... Tommy McCormick threw three touchdown passes for Cobleskill.
